Entries.default: Piqued at spotting you, the strapping warrior slams her shield against the floor, rattling the stones beneath your feet.
"Scurriers in my keep?! A new enemy arises in the heat of battle."
[Show her the torc.] "Look here! I recovered this from your fallen brenthís."
"Wait, hear me out first!"
[Brandish your weapon.] "We're to fight, then?"

"You felled her? And her dragon?!"

With a deep-chested growl, the warrior readies her sword to strike.
She stills, red scrawls in her skin flickering as she grimly appraises you.
"I hear your bleating well enough. Your words burn with the falseness of planned deception."
"There's a truth in the fire, a realness in death. In the finality of withering to nothing but ash."

"Nay, I am to fight. And you are to die." 

She raises her sword to strike.
"A kith, able to bear the torc?"
"He has a heat about him - a flicker of honor."
Entries.female: "She has a heat about her - a flicker of honor."

Entries.default: "May you rest in glory, soul burning in the ever-flame."
"Protect the shrine! Do not let the flames extinguish!"
"Make haste. The brenthís will return soon to herald the assault."
"The brenthís' return will herald the assault. We've no time to lose."
"A sacrifice to the goddess is the noblest of deaths. Magran will honor his soul."
Red-hot markings in the warrior's skin flare brighter as you near. She cranes her head appraisingly, muscles bulging, her neck sheening with fiery sweat.
"Magran's torc! The kith returns victorious."

"A scurrier bears the torc - yet is tempered instead of consumed. I must inform the bathor."

Abruptly, she charges into the depths of the keep, bellowing her news to all Rathun within hearing.
"No. It was the dragon who killed her, not me."
[Shrug.]
"Then the bathor will decide your fate. He awaits at the back of the keep."
"You will find no mercy in my flames."
"Fires take you!" Muscles flexing, she hefts her weapon to strike.

"Maybe Magran sends an omen - a kith wearing her guise."

She nods, decided.
"You worship Magran, kith?"
She bares her teeth, sword raised before her. But she appraises you before striking.
She stills, red scrawls in her skin flickering as she stares at the torc. Then with a huff, she lowers her shield.
"Take it to the bathor. He awaits at the back of the keep."
[Attack] "That's what the others said - right before I killed them."
[Shrug.]
She stills, red scrawls in her skin flickering as she grimly appraises you.

"Nay, I will not risk the spread of the defiler's filth during this time of crisis."

She readies her sword.
"May Magran forever burn your soul in agony. You'll find no mercy in the ever-flame."
A muscle ticks in her jaw. But finally, she sheaths her sword.
"Scurriers in my keep?! Make ready to be crushed, vermin of Eothas!"
